entry.title: YONCALLA RESIDENTS JAILED FOR WARRANTS

entry.title: PAVING WORK TO BRING LONGER DELAYS TO OAKLAND BRIDGE PROJECT AREA

entry.title: GOVERNOR KOTEK ANNOUNCES DEPARTURE OF CHIEF OF STAFF
entry.summary: March 25, 2024 3:05 a.m. On Friday, Governor Tina Kotek announced that her Chief of Staff, Andrea Cooper, will be leaving her office effective on March 29th. entry.title: WYDEN, COLLEAGUES INTRODUCE EAT LOCAL FOODS ACT
entry.summary: March 25, 2024 2:50 a.m. On Friday, Senator Ron Wyden said he has joined Senate colleagues in introducing legislation that would create a permanent grant program for state and tribal governments to use local food producers for hunger relief programs. entry.title: Eastwood students evict fish from hatchery, release into Deer Creek
entry.summary: Eastwood Elementary School released about 600 one-year-old steelhead into Deer Creek on Thursday morning. The students have been taking care of the fish throughout the year, maintaining their place as the nature school.

entry.title: Oregon's nonfarm payroll employment rises in February
entry.summary: In February, Oregon’s seasonally adjusted nonfarm payroll employment rose by 4,400 jobs, following a revised loss of 5,700 jobs in January.
